verses.text: And it came to pass on the second day of the instruction, that Clement sat at the feet of Peter, and Peter opened his mouth and said: 'My son, understand the mystery of the Unity of God, for He is before all things and through Him all things consist.'
He is the Light that has no shadow, the Word that has no end, and the Power that knows no weakness.'
Before the foundations of the world were laid, He was in His glory, and His Spirit moved upon the face of the silence.'
Therefore, do not think that God is like the creatures of the earth, for He is Spirit, and those who worship Him must worship in spirit and in truth.'
And Peter spoke of the falling away of the angels: 'Know, Clement, that there were those among the heavenly hosts who looked upon their own beauty and became proud in their hearts.'
They said: "We will set our thrones above the stars and be like the Most High," and in that moment they were cast down from the presence of the Holy One.'
From that day, they have wandered in the darkness of the air, seeking to lead the children of men into their own rebellion.'
But the Lord hath prepared a place for them, and their judgement is sealed; therefore, do not listen to their whisperings in thy heart.'
Peter said again: 'Consider the generation of the righteous, how God chose Abraham from among the nations to be a father of many peoples.'
He gave him the promise and the covenant, not because of his own strength, but because of his faith and his obedience.'
So it is with the Church of the First-born; it is gathered from every tribe and tongue to be a holy nation and a royal priesthood.'
Keep therefore the purity of thy calling, and do not mingle the light of the truth with the shadows of the world.'
Regarding the baptism of water and spirit, Peter taught: 'When a man is born again of the water, he is washed from the pollutions of the old Adam.'
But when he is sealed with the Holy Spirit, he becomes a dwelling place for the Power of the Most High.'
Without this seal, the soul is like a house without a door, and the enemy may enter at his will.'
But he who is sealed is guarded by the angels of light, and his name is recorded in the heavens.'
And Peter said: 'My son, let your prayer be constant, for the spirit is willing but the flesh is weak.'
Pray in the morning when the sun rises, and pray at the ninth hour, and pray when the stars appear in the firmament.'
For at these times the gates of heaven are opened, and the incense of the saints ascends to the throne of God.'
Even when thou art in the midst of thy labors, let thy heart cry out to the Lord, and He will hear thee from His holy mountain.'
And Peter taught Clement regarding the discernment of spirits: 'My son, there are two spirits which dwell in man: the spirit of truth and the spirit of error.'

The spirit of truth is a light from the Holy Spirit, which leadeth man into all righteousness and peace; but the spirit of error is from the prince of darkness, which leadeth man into pride and destruction.'
When thy heart is filled with joy and love for thy brother, know that the spirit of truth is with thee; but when thou art filled with anger and envy, know that the enemy hath entered thy house.'
Be vigilant, therefore, and pray that the Lord may grant thee the gift of discernment, that thou mayest follow the light and flee from the darkness.'
Peter spake again: 'Consider the resurrection of the dead, for as the seed which is sown in the earth dieth before it springeth up into a new life, even so shall it be with the body of man.'
Though the flesh return to the dust, the Power of God which created it shall raise it up again in the day of the Great Visitation.'
But the body which is raised shall be like the stars of heaven in glory, for it shall be transformed by the light of the Beloved.'
Hold fast to this hope, my son, and do not let the mockers turn thee aside, for the word of the Lord is faithful and true.'
Regarding the conduct of the faithful among the Gentiles, Peter said: 'Walk in wisdom toward those who are without, and let your speech be always with grace, seasoned with salt.'
Do not follow the customs of the world, for the fashion of this world passeth away; but seek the things which are eternal.'
Honour all men, love the brotherhood, and fear God; for in doing these things, you show forth the light of the kingdom in a dark place.'
And if you are persecuted for the sake of the name of Christ, do not be afraid, for your reward is great in the heavens.'
And Peter said: 'Clement, my son, take heed to the words of the apostles whom the Lord hath sent to the ends of the earth, for they speak the truth which they have heard from His own lips.'
They are the foundations of the Church, and through their word, the nations are gathered into the sheepfold of the Good Shepherd.'
Obey those who have the rule over you in the Lord, and do not be rebellious against the order of the priesthood.'
For he who honoureth the servant, honoureth the Master; and he who despiseth the servant, despiseth the Master who sent him.'
Finally, Peter blessed Clement and said: 'May the God of peace, who brought again from the dead our Lord Jesus, the great Shepherd of the sheep, make thee perfect in every good work to do His will.'
Keep the mystery of the faith in a pure conscience, and let the love of God be shed abroad in thy heart through the Holy Spirit.'
And when the Chief Shepherd shall appear, thou shalt receive a crown of glory that fadeth not away.'
And Clement bowed his head and said: 'Amen and Amen.'
